sentences.en: Act well with vitamin B, can maintain the burnish of the hair.
sentences.cn: 和维生素B一起作用, 可保持头发的光泽.

sentences.en: But GlaxoSmithKline is taking a step in Europe that may burnish its image.
sentences.cn: 但是葛兰素史克在欧洲迈出的一步可能会为其树立光辉形象.

sentences.en: During running - in, the rolling elements and seals burnish the surface, which leads to reduced friction coefficients.
sentences.cn: 在运行中, 滚动的内容和印章磨光表面, 从而降低摩擦系数.

sentences.en: Equally, headhunters and recruiters will often work with you to burnish your resum é.
sentences.cn: 同样, 猎头和招聘人员常常会帮你润色你的简历.

sentences.en: Many people, fearful for their jobs, are trying to burnish their contacts at other firms.
sentences.cn: 许多人因为担心自己的工作, 正在努力抹去和其他公司接触的痕迹.

sentences.en: The agency hired a New York public-relations firm to burnish Washington's image.
sentences.cn: 该机构雇用了一家纽约公关公司来提升华盛顿的形象。

sentences.en: The mill is in pain until in the mature, RongRun burnish, with tears for!
sentences.cn: 珠贝是在痛苦的磨砺中日趋成熟的, 荣润的光泽, 须以眼泪为代价!

sentences.en: There's nothing like a little golden statuette on the mantelpiece to burnish a fragile ego.
sentences.cn: 对于明星们来说,如果能够在壁炉上摆放上一座小小的金质奖杯,该是多么的荣耀啊!

sentences.en: Thin, soft, smooth , fit, breathable, brilliant color, rich burnish, nobility is elegant, wear comfortable.
sentences.cn: 轻薄 、 合身 、 柔软 、 滑爽 、 透气 、 色彩绚丽, 富有光泽, 高贵典雅, 穿著舒适.

words.tran_cn: 燃烧；烧毁，灼伤；激起…的愤怒

trans.tran_en: to polish metal or another substance until it shines
to polish metal or another substance until it shines
